column4: if I was going to install Ubuntu on my macbook pro, should I use x86 or amd64?
depends on what processor you have
click the apple in the top left hand corner and goto about this mac
i have intel core i7
then use the x86
unless you have a 64bit i7
it's 64bit - I'm running Lion right now, which is 64 bit only
iirc
i would test the amd64 ver but it may be buggy. if it is then use the x86
will I get any extra benefit if I use the 64bit version?
the benefits of using using your processor to its full potential
well yeah, but I'm just going to be using it for SSH, vim, and a handful of browsers
ok sorry
what was the last msg you sent
well yeah, but I'm just going to be using it for SSH, vim, and a handful of browsers
well then really its up to you.
why would the 64bit version be buggy?

well sometimes like on the acre 5135 the device bus is actually reported wrong to macosx86. you are trying to use ubuntu on a machine that is only supposed to use macos. eventhough it is an intel mac somethings just MAY not work without some work on your part
ah, i see. okay
I think i'll give the 64bit version a try
thanks!
np enjoy and please tell me about your exp
will do. thanks again!
